abstracts.cdata!:
The overall Education for all Fast-Track
            Initiative (EFA FTI) Catalytic Trust Fund Project for
            Mongolia goal is to ensure universal completion of basic
            education and to close the gender gap and rural/urban gap in
            enrollment and school completion by 2015. The closing date
            for the project will be extended from December 31, 2010
            until December 31, 2012. The Mongolian EFA FTI Project has
            been implemented well and has contributed to improving
            access to and completion of basic education (primary and
            secondary education), with particular attention to rural
            areas; improving the quality of basic education; expanding
            access to pre-school education in rural areas: and improving
            project management. The entire $29.4 million grant fund was
            transferred to the special account in tranches between 2007
            and 2010. As of September 30, 2010, 87 percent of the total
            grant was disbursed, with only 13 percent remaining. The
            construction of a new school not only will improve the
            teaching and learning environment, but also enables an
            extension of instructional time and improve learning outcomes.
